precautions: Stay hydrated - drink plenty of fluids (water, ORS, coconut water)
Avoid aspirin and NSAIDs (use paracetamol for fever)
Monitor for warning signs: severe abdominal pain, persistent vomiting, bleeding
Use mosquito nets and repellents to prevent transmission
Seek immediate medical care if platelet count drops significantly
home_care: Take paracetamol for fever (not aspirin or ibuprofen)
Get daily blood tests during critical phase (Day 4-7)
when_to_seek_emergency: Bleeding from gums, nose, or in stool/urine

precautions: Complete the full course of antimalarial medication
when_to_seek_emergency: High fever not responding to medication
Severe vomiting or inability to take oral medications

precautions: Wear a mask if around others
home_care: Take over-the-counter fever reducers as needed
Sleep in a prone position if having breathing difficulties
when_to_seek_emergency: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath at rest
Confusion or inability to stay awake
Sudden worsening of symptoms after initial improvement

precautions: Stay home and avoid contact with others
home_care: Take over-the-counter fever and pain relievers
Gargle with salt water for sore throat
when_to_seek_emergency: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath
Flu symptoms that improve then return with fever and worse cough

precautions: Stay hydrated with ORS or clear fluids
home_care: Drink small, frequent sips of fluids
Start with bland foods (BRAT: bananas, rice, applesauce, toast)
Avoid fatty, spicy, or heavily seasoned foods
when_to_seek_emergency: Signs of severe dehydration (dry mouth, dizziness, dark urine)

precautions: Complete the full course of antibiotics
Avoid preparing food for others during illness
home_care: Rest in bed during high fever
Sleep propped up if having breathing difficulties
when_to_seek_emergency: High fever not responding to medication

precautions: Identify and avoid triggers (stress, certain foods, lack of sleep)
Take prescribed medications at onset of symptoms
home_care: Rest in a dark, quiet room
Take pain medication early in the attack
when_to_seek_emergency: Sudden, severe headache (worst headache of life)
Headache with fever and stiff neck

precautions: Avoid spreading to others - cover coughs/sneezes
home_care: Use saline nasal spray or drops
Take over-the-counter cold medications as needed
when_to_seek_emergency: Severe headache, throat pain, or sinus pain

precautions: Check feet daily for wounds or infections
home_care: Limit sugary foods and refined carbohydrates
when_to_seek_emergency: Blood sugar above 400 mg/dL or below 70 mg/dL
Symptoms of diabetic ketoacidosis (nausea, vomiting, confusion)
Signs of hypoglycemia not responding to treatment

general_precautions: Always follow your healthcare provider's instructions
Never stop prescribed medications without consulting your doctor
Keep a record of your symptoms and vital signs
